title: RuntimeError: the number of sizes provided must be greater or equal to the number of dimensions in the tensor
body_html:
Same problem as #4228 , I try this code on the terminal,
a = Variable(torch.randn(1,1), requires_grad=True)
b = Variable(torch.randn(1,1), requires_grad=True)
d = torch.nn.functional.cosine_similarity(a,b)
d.backward()
then,
RuntimeError: invalid argument 1: the number of sizes provided must be greater or equal to the number of dimensions in the tensor at /pytorch/torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensor.c:299
I check the d is a scalar

Variable containing:
1
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1]

I'm a newbie of pytorch, so i'm not sure this code is meaningful.

body:
Same problem as #4228 , I try this code on the terminal,
`a = Variable(torch.randn(1,1), requires_grad=True)`
`b = Variable(torch.randn(1,1), requires_grad=True)`
`d = torch.nn.functional.cosine_similarity(a,b)`
`d.backward()`
then, 
`RuntimeError: invalid argument 1: the number of sizes provided must be greater or equal to the number of dimensions in the tensor at /pytorch/torch/lib/TH/generic/THTensor.c:299`
I check the d is a scalar

> Variable containing:
> 1
> [torch.FloatTensor of size 1]

I'm a newbie of pytorch, so i'm not sure this code is meaningful.
